Enter percentage to scale keys. Default = 100. Smaller numbers shrink keys. Larger numbers expand them.
What labels do you want to see on the keys?
What colors do you want to see?
What sounds do you want to hear?
Do you want to play looking at a landscape (wide) display?
What note arrangement on the keys do you want to use?
The octave of the highest note to include.
The lowest playable note to include.
The highest playable note to include.
The octave of the lowest playable note to include.

IsoKeys is an isomorphic musical keyboard. All intervals, chords, and scales have identical patterns, regardless of the key in which one plays. Similar in spirit to Musix for the iPad, IsoKeys aims to provide a starter isomorphic keyboard for Android users. See http://www.altkeyboards.com for more information about these instruments.

For more information about this project, please visit http://isokeys.sourceforge.net. Support requests may be made through this site, and source code is also available there under the terms of GNU Public License (version 3).
Distributed by Ineptisoft, a division of Ineptico, a figment of my imagination.

Sounds from the acoustic grand piano soundfont (Yamaha Disklavier Pro), release 2008-09-10, by Roberto Gordo Saez (roberto.gordo@gmail.com), were adapted for use in IsoKeys. (See http://zenvoid.org/audio.html.) Specifically, we translated a set of files (mostly from the third velocity layer) from the soundfont into Ogg Vorbis format, with a rather drastic loss of fidelity. Please do not take the IsoKeys piano sound as representative of the quality of this excellent soundfont. It just helped to start from a high-quality source.
This soundfont was built using the Zenph Studios Yamaha Disklavier Pro Piano Multisamples for OLPC, which was created by Dr. Mikhail Krishtal, Director of Music Research and Production, and his team at Zenph Studios.
Neither Dr. Krishtal nor Mr. Saez in any way endorses IsoKeys. Their work is used under the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 license. See http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 for details.

To improve the quality of our application, we reserve the right to track and report user activity inside IsoKeys. All data collected will be anonymous. We respect your privacy and will not collect any information to identify you personally.
